intro: Pedicularis yui var. ciliata, commonly known as the pink fairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. This species is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
